text: How to have an error but continue the script in python?
Suppose I have this code in Python:

code:
l = dict['link']
t = dict['title']        <<<<<<<<error here, there is no "title"
d = dict['description']
k = dict['keyword']

text: What if there is an error on line 2, but I want it to continue running the script and assign the other values?
EDIT: I know how to do a simple try, except.
However, Oftentimes when there is an error on #2, it will shoot to the except, and then NOT continue the rest of the code.
EDIT: I understand that there is a "get" method.
However, I'd like a GENERAL way of doing it...I won't always be using dictionaries.
